segment.source: Reference

segment.source: When a session is locked in a Windows operating system (meaning the user at the computer pressed CTRL+ALT+DEL and the Secure Desktop is displayed), user information is displayed.
segment.target: When a session is locked in a Windows operating system (meaning the user at the computer pressed CTRL+ALT+DEL and the Secure Desktop is displayed), user information is displayed.

segment.source: By default, this information is in the form of user name is logged on.
segment.target: By default, this information is in the form of user name is logged on.

segment.source: The displayed user name is the user’s full name as set on the Properties page for that user.
segment.target: The displayed user name is the user’s full name as set on the Properties page for that user.

segment.source: These settings do not apply to the logon tiles, which are displayed on the desktop after using the Switch User feature.
segment.target: These settings do not apply to the logon tiles, which are displayed on the desktop after using the Switch User feature.

segment.source: The information that is displayed can be changed to meet your security requirements using the following possible values.
segment.target: The information that is displayed can be changed to meet your security requirements using the following possible values.

segment.target: Possible values

segment.target: User display name, domain and user names

segment.target: If this is a local logon, the user’s full name is displayed on the Secure Desktop.

segment.source: If it is a domain logon, the user’s domain and user’s account name is displayed.
segment.target: If it is a domain logon, the user’s domain and user’s account name is displayed.

segment.target: User display name only

segment.source: The name of the user who locked the session is displayed on the Secure Desktop as the user’s full name.
segment.target: The name of the user who locked the session is displayed on the Secure Desktop as the user’s full name.

segment.source: Vulnerability
segment.target: Vulnerability

segment.source: When a computer displays the Secure Desktop in an unsecured area, certain user information can be readily available to anyone looking at the monitor, either physically or through a remote connection.
segment.target: When a computer displays the Secure Desktop in an unsecured area, certain user information can be readily available to anyone looking at the monitor, either physically or through a remote connection.

segment.source: The displayed user information could include the domain user account name or the full name of the user who locked the session or who had logged on last.
segment.target: The displayed user information could include the domain user account name or the full name of the user who locked the session or who had logged on last.

segment.source: Countermeasure
segment.target: Countermeasure

segment.source: Enabling this policy setting allows the operating system to hide certain user information from being displayed on the Secure Desktop (after the device has been booted or when the session has been locked by using CTRL+ALT+DEL).
segment.target: Enabling this policy setting allows the operating system to hide certain user information from being displayed on the Secure Desktop (after the device has been booted or when the session has been locked by using CTRL+ALT+DEL).

segment.source: However, user information is displayed if the Switch user feature is used so that the logon tiles are displayed for each logged on user.
segment.target: However, user information is displayed if the Switch user feature is used so that the logon tiles are displayed for each logged on user.

segment.source: You might also want to enable the Interactive logon: Do not display last user name policy, which will prevent the Windows operating system from displaying the logon name and logon tile of the last user to logon.
segment.target: You might also want to enable the Interactive logon: Do not display last user name policy, which will prevent the Windows operating system from displaying the logon name and logon tile of the last user to logon.

segment.source: Potential impact
segment.target: Potential impact

segment.source: If you do not enable this policy, the effect will be the same as enabling the policy and selecting the User display name, domain and user names option.
segment.target: If you do not enable this policy, the effect will be the same as enabling the policy and selecting the User display name, domain and user names option.

segment.source: If the policy is enabled and set to Do not display user information, an observer cannot see who is logged onto the Secure Desktop, but the logon tile is still present if the Interactive logon: Do not display last user name policy is not enabled.
segment.target: If the policy is enabled and set to Do not display user information, an observer cannot see who is logged onto the Secure Desktop, but the logon tile is still present if the Interactive logon: Do not display last user name policy is not enabled.

segment.source: Depending on how the logon tiles are configured, they could provide visual clues as to who is logged on.
segment.target: Depending on how the logon tiles are configured, they could provide visual clues as to who is logged on.

segment.source: In addition, if the Interactive logon: Do not display last user name policy is not enabled, then the Switch user feature will show user information.
segment.target: In addition, if the Interactive logon: Do not display last user name policy is not enabled, then the Switch user feature will show user information.
